casebody.data:
VIRGINIA IRON, COAL & COKE CO., Plaintiff in Error, v. EASLEY COTTON MILLS, Defendant in Error. (Circuit Court of Appeals, Fourth Circuit. June 15, 1925.) No. 2327. B. E. Martin, of Greenville, S. C. (Martin & Blythe and E. M. Blythe, all of Green-ville, S. ’C., and L. A. Nuekols, of Roanoke, Va., on the brief), for plaintiff in error. H. J. Haynsworth, of Greenville, S. ,C. (C. E. Haynsworth and Haynsworth & Haynsworth, all of Greenville, S. C., on the brief), for defendant ip error.

Before WOODS, WADDILL, and ROSE. Circuit Judges.

WOODS, Circuit Judge.

This ease was tried with that of Virginia Iron, Coal & Coke Co. v. Woodside Cotton Mills Co., 6 F.(2d) 442, and involves the same questions.

In accordance with the opinion therein, filed this day the judgment in this case is affirmed.
